document.docAuthor: Psarras, Christos, Merle, Didier & Koskeridou, Efterpi
document.docTitle: Conus (Lautoconus) ictini Psarras & Merle & Koskeridou 2022, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Late Miocene Conidae (Mollusca: Gastropoda) of Crete (Greece). Part 2

subSubSection.paragraph:
Conus ( Varioconus ) pelagicus
–
Landau et al. 2013
: pl. 82 fig. 2a–b
(non
Conus ( Lautoconus ) pelagicus Brocchi, 1814
).
A species with smooth, low angled, conical spire whorls and bricked-wall-like colour pattern.
Name taken after Ictinus (Latin translation of the ancient Greek Ἰκτῖνος), one of the two architects of the Parthenon.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype
GREECE –
Crete
• Tefeli ; Messara Basin , Tortonian ; Efterpi Koskeridou leg.; AMPG(IV) 3719 .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Paratypes
GREECE –
Crete
• 1 spec.; same collection data as for holotype; AMPG(IV) 3720
•
1 spec.; same collection data as for holotype; AMPG(IV) 3718
.

Other material GREECE –
Crete
• 1 spec.; Filippi ; 35.035° N , 25.250° E ; 2017; Christos Psarras leg.; AMPG(IV) 3717
•
2 specs; Achladhia ; 1964; Nikolaos Symeonidis leg.; AMPG(IV) 3715 to AMPG(IV) 3716
.

Morphologically ( Table 2 ), this species is very similar to
Conus ( Lautoconus ) pelagicus Brocchi, 1814
. It differs slightly in the smoother spire whorls and a more inflated appearance ( Fig. 4 ). The occurrence of this morphotype, at multiple localities and ages (Serravallian, Turkey (
Landau et al. 2013
) and Tortonian, Greece (this work)), is evidence for the existence of a separate species.
Conus ( Lautoconus ) ictini
sp. nov. has a distinct brick-like colour pattern, making it possible to distinguish it safely from other species under UV light.
Conus ( Lautoconus ) eschewegi
(
Landau et al. 2013
: pl. 82 fig. 1a–b, see Remarks above) displays multiple spiral dots and dashes, while
Conus ( Lautoconus ) ictini
sp. nov . bears multiple continuous spiral lines and vertical brick-like patterns. The colour pattern of
Conus ( Lautoconus ) ictini
sp. nov. is very similar to that of the extant
Conus ( Quasiconus ) melvilli Sowerby, 1879
, a species inhabiting the Arabian Peninsula ( Moolenbeek & Coomans 1993 ).

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 4.
Conus ( Lautoconus ) ictini
sp. nov. from the Tortonian of Crete (Greece) on apertural, abapertural and apical views, under natural (A1, A3, A4, B1) and UV light. A . Holotype AMPG(IV) 3719, Tefeli. B . Paratype AMPG(IV) 3720, Tefeli. C . Paratype AMPG(IV) 3718, Tefeli. D . Specimen AMPG(IV) 3716, Achladhia. Scale bar = 1 cm .

Table 2. Shell measurements and ratios of seven specimens of
Conus ( Lautoconus ) ictini
sp. nov. from the Tortonian of Crete (Greece). The largest specimen is AMPG(IV) 3715.
